place.name: CHARLCOMBE
place.gazetteerText: CHARLCOMBE, a parish in Bath district, Somerset; near the Great Western railway, 1½ mile N of Bath. Post Town, Bath. Acres, 571. Real property, £3,604. Pop., 378. Houses, 37. The property is divided among a few. Water works are here for supplying the city of Bath. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £200.* Patrons, the Mayor and Corporation of Bath. The church is ancient and curious. but good; and the churchyard contains a very old yew tree. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
